TopicTitle: [0.25] Lionhead Aerospace Inc. - Icarus v0.4 updated

Articles.Content:
New features for Ariane 5: new EAPs (SRBs) with a new nosecone (parchute and tiny decoupling SRBs).

Here a test video:
Looking real nice. I wish more people did the mini-SRB thing for separation, so much more realistic.
Public service announcement: Ariane V / ATV launch today (6/5/2013) at 21:52 GMT!
Can you give us a link to the streaming site?

Can you give us a link to the streaming site?

Sure thing!

http://www.arianespace.tv/

Sure thing!

http://www.arianespace.tv/

I too thank you for the link. Just one more hour to go until launch. I hope nothing bad happens.

Public service announcement: Ariane V / ATV launch today (6/5/2013) at 21:52 GMT!

Thanks for reminding me

Edited June 5, 2013 by Netris
Solid launch. New upperstage?

interesting, that they use a 10 day rendezvous window (from launch, to dock).

Some KSP users get annoyed to have to wait 10min. lol

Solid launch. New upperstage?

Guess not - they said that's the configuration that's been used on all the ATV flights.

interesting, that they use a 10 day rendezvous window (from launch, to dock).

Some KSP users get annoyed to have to wait 10min. lol

Yet soyuz just beat there previous record of 6 hours, to a little under 6 hours just a few weeks ago.

Yet soyuz just beat there previous record of 6 hours, to a little under 6 hours just a few weeks ago.

But the cargo does not get annoyed cause it has to live in a capsule of the size of a Smart for 10 days :V

lol, true, cargo rarely gets annoyed. - oddly Kerbals never seem annoyed at waiting either...

Thus Kerbals ARE cargo.

CARGO HAS FEELINGS MAN, you just hurt them, you'll never be able to apologize to ATV-4 for two reasons,

  1. You're not on the ISS
  2. It will burn up in atmospheric re-entry

CARGO HAS FEELINGS MAN, you just hurt them, you'll never be able to apologize to ATV-4 for two reasons,

  1. You're not on the ISS
  2. It will burn up in atmospheric re-entry

The way the french commentator talked about it, you can easily said ATV has feeling. We even laughted about it with a friend of mine

Somehow missed the fact that the launch was today; I really wanted to watch it live. I could have watched it too if I had known, I was done for the day and just chatting with one of my advisors for my summer internship at JSC!

Not working in .20.

Do you know when MSL/DSL might be fixed? Thanks

Edited June 6, 2013 by Anthony Frushour

Somehow missed the fact that the launch was today; I really wanted to watch it live. I could have watched it too if I had known, I was done for the day and just chatting with one of my advisors for my summer internship at JSC!

You didn't missed too much. Nothing exploded sadly
I'm pretty sure that would be bad for the ISS crew if the Ariane 5 had exploded; seeing as they need the supplies and the Shuttle isn't flying anymore.

I'm pretty sure that would be bad for the ISS crew if the Ariane 5 had exploded; seeing as they need the supplies and the Shuttle isn't flying anymore.
Progress, ATV can just carry more. They're also pretty sustainable up there. They have a huge backlog of food usually.

Progress undocks in 4 days, probably not much left. Also, MSL/DSL have a coding glitch for .20 with cleverbobcat, I'm working on tons of different edits to fix them, but I got other projects I'm working on.

The way the french commentator talked about it, you can easily said ATV has feeling. We even laughted about it with a friend of mine

Obviously ATV-4 is a genius because his name is Albert Einstein.

Do you know when MSL/DSL might be fixed? Thanks

I find a way to fix DSL Pandora, but still some grey textures issues. Prometheus doesn't work at all. May be need to update them with the new wheel module.
Yogui, lets go ahead with Ariane 5's update, I don't see problems that are significant enough to make them wait.

You guys made the Thor probe right?

Just one thing, why did you turn the Thor probe's core and science parts into separate pieces? Craft which had the core part on it are now going to be without instruments.
